revised_title: The Interaction of Ovarian Hormones in the Menstrual Cycle of Primates
tldr: This study investigates the interaction of ovarian hormones in the menstrual cycles of primates, specifically focusing on the endocrine mechanisms that operate in cycles with ovulation. The research aims to define experimental conditions that conform to the phases of the normal cycle and result in uterine bleeding at approximately 4-weekly intervals in ovariectomized rhesus monkeys treated with both oestrin and progestin. The findings contribute to understanding the menstrual cycle and the role of hormones in it.
